ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So when you have finished, work on,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So when you are free work diligently,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So, whenever you are free, strive in devotion,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When you are free from (your obligations), strive hard (to worship God)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So when you finish the prayer, strive in supplication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So when you have finished, devote yourself to Allah's worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So when you are free, nominate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So when thou art empty, labour,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So when thou art relieved, still toil
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: So, when you are free, strive hard,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then when thou becometh relieved, toil;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So when you are done, appoint,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Therefore, when thou art free (from thine immediate task), still labour hard,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So when you have finished (from your occupation), then stand up for Allah's worship (i.e. stand up for prayer).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So, when you have finished (your prayer), labor (in supplication),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When your work is done, turn to devotion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [94:7] So when you are finished, from [performing] prayer, toil, exert yourself in supplication [to God],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: So when thou art relieved) when you finish from military expeditions, jihad and fighting, (still toil) in worship; and it is also said this means: when you finish from the prescribed prayers, make supplications
